text: When things don't go as planned, I blame myself instead of trying to fix the situation.
When I experience a creative block, I completely disengage instead of forcing myself to continue.
When solving problems, I use unconventional approaches instead of standard methods.
When someone rejects my idea, I abandon it instead of refining it.
I see connections between seemingly unrelated concepts instead of focusing on obvious connections.
When brainstorming, I generate many wild ideas instead of focusing on practical ones.
I question conventional wisdom instead of accepting established methods.
When creating something new, I discover it as I go instead of starting with a clear vision.
I find inspiration in unexpected places instead of sticking to familiar sources.
When my first solution fails, I quickly pivot instead of analyzing what went wrong.
I combine ideas from different fields to create something unique instead of using ideas from a single field.
When others say 'that won't work,' I see it as a challenge instead of a warning.
I enjoy exploring 'what if' scenarios even when they seem impractical instead of focusing only on practical scenarios.
When stuck, I seek diverse perspectives instead of trusting my own judgment.
I notice patterns others miss instead of focusing on what's immediately obvious.
When creating, I prioritize originality instead of effectiveness.
I experiment with different approaches even when one seems sufficient instead of settling for what appears adequate.
When my idea conflicts with tradition, I stand firm instead of adapting it.
I see limitations as boundaries to respect instead of obstacles to overcome.
When inspiration strikes at inconvenient times, I let it pass instead of capturing it.
